data.question: What is the main focus of the work regarding ZnPC-2 and its iso-reticular structures?
data.answer: The main focus is on exploring the precise Lewis acidic site on Zn3-SBU by using the cycloaddition of CO2 and epoxides as a probe reaction, and how the tetrahedral coordinated Zn(II) in Zn3-SBU serves as the Lewis acidic site for the catalytic CO2 cycloaddition reaction.

data.question: What role does TBAB play in the cycloaddition reaction of CO2 with epichlorohydrin?
data.answer: TBAB serves as a co-catalyst that is crucial for the nucleophilic attacking, significantly increasing the yield of the cycloaddition reaction when present.

data.question: How does the presence of Hpyr@ZnPC-2 affect the catalytic efficiency compared to ZnPC-2?
data.answer: Hpyr@ZnPC-2 shows similar catalytic efficiency to ZnPC-2 when TBAB is present as a co-catalyst, indicating that the occupation of Hpyr inside the channel doesnâ€™t block the active Lewis acidic site.

data.question: What is the significance of the apical Zn(II) in Zn3-SBU for the catalytic reaction?
data.answer: The apical Zn(II) in Zn3-SBU is identified as the dominant catalytic Lewis acidic site in CO2 cycloaddition reaction, and its ability to dynamically transform from tetrahedron to high coordination geometry plays a crucial role in the catalysis process.

data.question: What experimental and theoretical methods were used to investigate the catalytic mechanism of ZnPC-2?
data.answer: DFT calculations and experimental studies including CO2 adsorption experiments and catalytic CO2 cycloaddition reactions were used to investigate the catalytic mechanism of ZnPC-2.

data.question: Is the reaction of CO2 cycloaddition with epoxides over ZnPC-2 size-selective?
data.answer: Yes, the reaction is size-selective, as demonstrated by the varying yields of corresponding cyclic carbonates when different epoxides are used as substrates.

data.question: Can Hpyr@ZnPC-2 be reused in the cycloaddition reaction of CO2 with epoxides?
data.answer: Yes, Hpyr@ZnPC-2 can be easily separated by centrifugation and reused for at least four successive runs with the yield maintained above 90%.

data.question: Does the coordination geometry of the apical Zn(II) in Zn3-SBU remain unchanged during the catalytic process?
data.answer: No, the coordination geometry of the apical Zn(II) in Zn3-SBU undergoes a dynamical and reversible transformation during the catalytic process.

data.question: What is the effect of substituting other metal ions for Zn in Zn3-SBU on the catalytic activity?
data.answer: Substituting other metal ions for Zn in Zn3-SBU results in moderate catalytic yields, suggesting the crucial role of the apical Zn(II) in catalytic activity.

data.question: What conclusion can be drawn about the role of reticular chemistry in the design of CO2 reduction catalysts?
data.answer: Reticular chemistry plays a crucial role in designing CO2 reduction catalysts by enabling the construction of iso-reticular frameworks and precise regulation of catalytic sites.
